intro: Acinodendron polyneurum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including pink, purple, and white. Acinodendron polyneurum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
